data.title: Corum Group
data.text:
CheckFree to Buy Carreker

CheckFree Corporation is acquiring Carreker Corporation, a financial services software developer and consultant, significantly expanding its software business and consulting expertise, and broadening its leadership in offering payment solutions to the financial industry. Carreker complements CheckFree's solutions in delivering fraud management, risk mitigation and operational excellence with a substantial potential return on investment in new technology.

Announcement Date: January 2, 2007

Deal Value: $206 million (cash and debt)

Seller Revenue: $114.42 million ttm

ePayments Acquires Automated Check Recovery

ePayments Corp., an electronic payments processing and support services company, acquired Automated Check Recovery (ACR). Since U.S. banking system rules were changed to allow businesses to use the Automated Clearing House network (ACH) and Check 21 methodologies to electronically process checks from customers, a new industry of providers has emerged to support businesses with electronic check conversion, electronic NSF collection and related compliance services. The acquisition adds a substantial number of educational services accounts to ePayments Corp.'s electronic check collection (RCK) business. Further, ACR expands ePayments presence in the educational services marketplace.

Announcement Date: January 3, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

iOM Acquires ATLAS

iOM, one of Asias pioneering IT companies which has been in the industry for over 25 years and led by Sri Lankans, expands its financial services software product line with the acquisition of ATLAS, a policy administration system for life insurance companies, unit trusts and investment managers. This announcement coincides with the opening of the Australian arm of iOM. The acquisition of ATLAS marks the first step in iOMs expansion into financial services software technology. With the acquisition of a high quality and proven life insurance policy administration product, iOM can expand its products in Sri Lanka and other markets in Southeast Asia, the Middle East and Africa.

Announcement Date: January 5, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

i-flex solutions Acquires Capco Division

i-flex solutions will acquire the Singapore consulting practice of Capco  The Capital Markets Company Pte Ltd. The deal is in line with i-flexs strategic initiative to address business transformation requirements of top tier financial institutions. The i-flex-Capco team would be capable of providing expertise to assist banks in business transformation, management of large technology implementations and addressing risk and compliance requirements.

i-flex is a subsidiary of Oracle; recently i-flex, Oracle and IBM joined hands to combine the architectural expertise of IBM, core banking and risk solution capability of i-flex and banking and specific application solutions skills of Oracle. With banks in the Asia Pacific region, including Japan, transforming their operations by upgrading their technology platforms and adopting new core-processing platforms, there is a demand for i-flex product.

Announcement Date: January 8, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Wolters Kluwer Acquires Banconsumer Service, Inc.

Wolters Kluwer Financial Services is acquiring Banconsumer Service, Inc., a provider of regulatory compliance-related documentation solutions. BANCO's main offerings include pre-printed and electronic forms for the indirect lending market, as well as for the mortgage and home equity markets. With the acquisition of BANCO, whose product portfolio supplies auto lenders and dealers with retail installment contracts for auto loans and leases in all 51 U.S. jurisdictions, Wolters Kluwer Financial Services will provide customized pre-printed forms, electronic documents and e-contracting solutions to the majority of top tier U.S. auto finance lenders.

Announcement Date: January 17, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

State Street to Acquire Currenex

State Street Corp., one of the world's largest custody banks for institutional investors, will buy Currenex Inc. for $564 million in cash to add electronic foreign exchange trading services. Currenex is an independently owned online platform that serves banks, hedge funds and other active traders. Boston-based State Street said the purchase would augment its FX Connect foreign exchange trading platform, which topped $108 billion of trading volume in a single day in December, 2006

Announcement Date: January 22, 2007

Deal Value: $564 million (cash)

Wombat Acquires Harco Technology

Wombat Financial Software Inc., provider of low latency and direct feed market data solutions, acquired Harco Technology Ltd., provider of market data usage reporting and compliance technology. The acquisition of Harco, which services the market data spend management needs of over 70 trading floors worldwide, will further enhance Wombat's product offering, and has already been applauded by many Wombat and Harco customers. The combination of Harco's best-of-breed usage and reporting product line and the Wombat Entitlements System, gives the company a compelling off-the-shelf exchange entitlements and usage reporting solution. The acquisition comes at a time when many securities exchanges have become more forceful in trying to monetize the value of their market data products, including the possible imposition of significant financial penalties upon those who fail to properly control and report upon usage of their content.

Announcement Date: January 22, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

First Data Acquires Size Technologies

First Data Corp, has acquired Size Technologies, Inc., a provider of loyalty, stored value and transaction marketing solutions. The acquisition of Size Technologies enables First Data to offer merchants, issuers, and coalition partners a real-time point of sale, tender-neutral loyalty solution that will help drive profitable customer behavior. Participating clients will also have access to loyalty features and functionality including couponing, consumer messaging, product-based rewards, robust customer relationship management and a campaign management tool.

Announcement Date: January 25, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

SunGard Acquires XRTs High-end Treasury Product Lines

SunGard has acquired XRTs high-end treasury product lines, Globe$ and TWS. The acquisition includes all current customer contracts, intellectual property, sales, marketing and development assets relating to these product lines as well as responsibility for customer support and maintenance of these products lines. Through this acquisition, SunGard can now offer Globe$ and TWS customers a high level of support, along with a future development path. AvantGard offers subject matter expertise and technical consulting to help bring ongoing value to this customer base.

Announcement Date: January 26, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Skywire Software Acquires Integrated Insurance Technologies

Skywire Software, a diversified enterprise software company, has acquired Integrated Insurance Technologies, provider of the largest life insurance industry processing portal, from SelectQuote, Inc. The acquisition continues Skywire Softwares aggressive plans for growth in servicing the insurance and financial services industries by further expanding its presence in the life sector. The acquisition complements Skywire Softwares customer base, which already includes leading Property and Casualty (P&C) carriers and top ten Managing General Agencies. IIT not only offers complementary products, but a team led by industry veterans who together bring innovation and leadership in developing standards-based software for the life sector.

Announcement Date: January 29, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Citigroup to Buy Prudential's Egg Bank

Citigroup Inc. announced that it was buying the world's largest standalone online bank (with over 3 million customers)  London-based Egg Banking PLC  to expand its financial operations in Britain and its Internet expertise worldwide. The combination of Egg and Citigroup's British consumer banking and finance operations will create a financial services provider with over 4 million customers and more than quadruple Citigroup's 800,000 British credit card base. Citigroup, the largest bank by assets in the United States, has eschewed blockbuster deals and, instead, focused on targeted and strategic acquisitions such as the Egg Banking purchase. In December, Citigroup announced it was buying Quilter, a wealth management unit in the United Kingdom, from Morgan Stanley; at the same time, it bought a Central American banking company in a stock-and-cash deal.

Announcement Date: February 1, 2007

Deal Value: $1.3 billion (cash)

Root Markets Acquires LeadROI

Root Markets Inc., which operates commodities exchange for trading and monetizing Internet-generated consumer leads, acquired LeadROI, Inc., provider of fully-integrated mortgage lead and customer relationship management system. LeadROI will operate as Root LeadROI, a subsidiary of Root Markets. Together, the companies will offer unique end-to-end solutions designed to close the loop between lead generation and lead conversion and enhance the value of purchased leads.

Announcement Date: February 5, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Edentify Acquires Zelcom Group

Edentify, Inc., a provider of identity management solutions, has acquired Zelcom Group, a privately held provider of data analytics solutions. The acquisition adds Zelcom's advanced data analysis service to Edentify's portfolio of identity theft and fraud prevention products. The data analysis service makes Edentify's Identity Quotient Index risk scoring technology more robust, further developing the company's products into cutting-edge identity fraud detection and prevention tools. The acquisition also enables Edentify to target Zelcom's customers, which includes top mortgage firms.

Announcement Date: February 6, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

SunGard Acquires Maxim Insurance Software Corporation

SunGard has acquired Maxim Insurance Software Corporation, a provider of premium billing systems for the property and casualty industry. Maximsoft will become part of SunGard's iWORKS product family. Maximsoft solutions include the Ebenezer system. Ebenezer is a rules-based billing and collections system. An organization using Ebenezer is able to bill all of its companies, and all of their affiliates, while using any combination of billing methodologies, all within one installation of the system. SunGard will continue to position Ebenezer as a billing solution for use by property and casualty insurers and as a complementary solution to SunGard's range of existing applications.

Announcement Date: February 13, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

CheckFree to Acquire Corillian Corporation

CheckFree Corporation to purchase Corillian Corporation, provider of Internet banking software and services. The acquisition will bring together Corillian's widely used online banking platform and complementary suite of financial applications, and CheckFree's industry-leading electronic billing and payment and online transaction services, which include electronic billing content and a highly efficient infrastructure that connects banks, billers and millions of consumers. Together, CheckFree and Corillian will be well positioned to help financial institutions optimize the online channel and drive increased usage of electronic billing and payment. The acquisition will also provide greater flexibility in technology approaches for financial institution efficiency and provide a platform for driving new services and service differentiation.

Announcement Date: Feb. 14, 2007

Deal Value: $245 million (cash and debt)

Seller Revenue: $60.96 million ttm

SunGard Acquires Aceva Technologies

SunGard has acquired Aceva Technologies, a provider of receivables management software solutions. The acquisition of Aceva extends SunGard's AvantGard solution suite for Collaborative Financial Management into the SaaS hosted solutions and business process outsourcing spaces. The addition of Aceva to SunGards development and services organizations will help the company to accelerate innovation and expand its distribution channels and support of channel and alliance initiatives. Further, it will help SunGard deliver enhanced services and capabilities to its customers based on a single platform for managing the entire credit operation.

Announcement Date: February 15, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Payless Telecom Solutions Acquired GRID Merchant Processing

Payless Telecom Solutions, Inc. acquired a majority stake in GRID Merchant Processing Inc. GRID is a leader in Internet-based credit card processing and electronic check processing for Internet, mail order/phone order, and brick and mortar retail businesses. This strategic acquisition, which combines telecom and merchant banking, will place both companies among a unique group of companies in that sector, combining telecom with a payment gateway solution. The alliance will create a company very similar to Lightbridge, Inc., a leading e-commerce, analytics and decisioning company.

Announcement Date: February 15, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

First Data Corp to Acquire Intelligent Results

First Data Corp., to acquire Intelligent Results, a customer data analytics and decision management software company. Intelligent Results has developed a proprietary customer analytics and decision management platform that integrates and automates the data analytics to action process. The company currently serves clients in the financial services, utilities and government services markets. The acquisition of Intelligent Results allows First Data to continue to secure transaction processing volume by integrating high-quality, value-added analytics products into the processing stream, and clearly supports First Datas strategies of growing its core business and expanding its products.

Announcement Date: February 20, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

First Data Acquires Datawire Communication Networks

First Data Corp. has acquired Datawire Communication Networks Inc., a developer of Internet-based transaction delivery solution. Datawire Communication Networks Inc. offers the Datawire VXN, a globally deployed Transaction Delivery Network. The VXN is a fast and secure network built for moving transactions over the Internet, and fully managed by Datawire. The VXN network is designed to globally transport any real-time data, such as financial transactions, with optimum security and reliability. The acquisition helps First Data further its lead and commitment to Internet Protocol-based transactions. The Datawire VXN technology is an important and strategic complement to other recently announced proprietary products including the FD-100 terminal and the First Data POS Value Exchange.

Announcement Date: February 21, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

PayPoint Acquired SECPay Limited

PayPoint Plc, a cash and Internet payments group, has acquired SECPay Limited, an Internet payment service provider (PSP). SECPay is a fast-growing processor of real-time card payments for goods and services bought over the Internet. It offers over 3,500 web merchants a gateway into their choice of any UK acquiring bank for authorizing debit and credit card transactions. The service complements that of PayPoints existing PSP subsidiary Metacharge, which works with selected acquirers only and offers settlement and risk management services in addition to an authorization gateway.

Announcement Date: February 26, 2007

Deal Value: $23.6 million (cash)

Seller Revenue: $3.7 million FY 2006

Thomson Acquires CrossBorder Solutions

The Thomson Corporation has acquired CrossBorder Solutions, a leading tax software company whose products are relied upon by many of the world's largest corporations for their planning and compliance needs. The acquisition will enable Thomson Tax & Accounting to expand into the transfer pricing/tax market and enhance its offerings in the tax provisions market  two fast-growing markets in the corporate tax segment. As an international tax solutions provider, CrossBorder Solutions' products facilitate transfer pricing documentation and FAS 109 compliance to multinational, publicly traded companies based in the United States and Europe.

Announcement Date: March 9, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Temenos Acquires ACTIS BSP

Swiss banking systems vendor Temenos is acquiring ACTIS.BSP, a Germany-based provider of core banking and securities technology. ACTIS.BSP is a subsidiary of Flexible Management Systems (FMS) and provides technology to financial services firms including Dresdner Bank, Postbank, DekaBank and DaimlerChrysler Bank. Approximately 50% of the firm's revenue is recurring maintenance and outsourcing revenue. Temenos says the acquisition will provide it with access to the German market, an additional client base of over 30 financial institutions and a further 144 staff.

Announcement Date: March 12, 2007

Deal Value: $19 million (cash)

SS&C Technologies, Inc. to Acquire Northport, LLC

SS&C Technologies, Inc., a global provider of financial services software and outsourcing solutions, has acquired Northport, LLC. Northport, LLC is the fifth SS&C acquisition in the fund administration arena representing one more expansion of SS&C's fund administration outsourcing business. Northport clients range from large firms with numerous investment vehicles to start-ups with a single fund. As an administrator devoted to the private equity community, Northport brings a concentration of experience and 21 skilled professionals to SS&C's fund administration offering.

Announcement Date: Mach 13, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Fiserv Acquires NetEconomy

Fiserv, Inc. has acquired NetEconomy, a leading financial crime management and compliance solutions provider to financial institutions across the globe. NetEconomy, owned by Esprit Capital Partners since August 2005, provides highly effective and easily deployable solutions for anti-money laundering, fraud prevention and compliance. NetEconomy's proven products and strong management team will help Fiserv deliver value in the important growth area of enterprise risk management. Fiserv will now be able to provide banks, thrifts and credit unions a solution for both anti-money laundering and fraud management, which will be integrated into its entire core account processing platforms.

Announcement Date: March 14, 2007
